sponsor.partnerMessage: Dance like no one’s watching. Insulate your attic like it costs nothing. SWEPCO’s Home Performance with ENERGY STAR® Pathway provides no-cost, energy-saving home improvements like attic insulation, air sealing and more. Sign up today to see if you qualify.

posts.title: Razorback Softball Team Set Up To Make Program History
posts.content:
After yet another big victory on Sunday, the Arkansas softball team is heading into the NCAA Super Regionals this week at Bogle Park.

  • Where to watch: Arkansas will be playing Texas in the Fayetteville Super Regionals, and their first game is on Thursday, May 26, at 6p CT on ESPN2. Friday’s game will be at 5:30p on ESPN. Any individual in-person game tickets will be made available on the morning of that day’s game, and you can contact the Razorback Ticket Center at 479-575-5151.
  • Making history: If Arkansas wins the Super Regionals, they will make program history and be the first Arkansas softball team to go to the Women’s College World Series. 

Stay updated HERE.

posts.title: Local Photography Studio Scheduling Sessions Through November
posts.content:
Photographs of your maternity journey, your newborn, or your child’s milestones are captured moments you’ll hold onto for the rest of your life.

  • Types: Rustic Arrow Photography offers maternity, newborn, and milestone sessions — all luxury experiences where you can come in, relax and enjoy the experience along with your child. Rustic Arrow is currently booking for July-November due dates. 
  • Fifteen minutes: If you’re interested in a quick summertime shoot, book a special wildflower mini session for Saturday, August 6, at Wonderland Tree Farm in Pea Ridge. 

Inquire about regular sessions HERE.

posts.title: NWA Businesses Secure 10th Year On Fortune 500 List
posts.content:
Two Northwest Arkansas businesses have recently earned their places on the Fortune 500 list for the 10th consecutive year. 

  • J.B. Hunt: J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc. ranked #311 on the 2022 list, moving up four spots from its position last year. The president and chief executive officer at J.B. Hunt said the ranking is a "testament to the culture of innovation and excellence we strive for at J.B. Hunt."
  • Walmart: This year, Walmart extended its streak at the #1 spot on the list after successfully navigating a challenging year in 2021. With its expanded e-commerce offerings, curbside pick-up, in-home delivery services, and driverless vehicle and drone testing, it's not hard to see why Walmart is still at the top.

Click HERE to see to complete Fortune 500 list.

posts.title: Primary Election Day Today
posts.content:
Primary Election day is today, and what better way to shape our region than to show up and vote?

  • Guides: The Northwest Arkansas Council and 4029 News have created voting guides, and the Arkansas Democrat-Gazette's guide includes information about each Arkansas candidate, voting locations, etc.
  • Know your government: You'll find candidates for the U.S. Senate and House of Representatives on the ballot among state-level positions such as the governor, lieutenant governor, attorney general, secretary of state, state treasurer, state auditor, commissioner of lands, and the Arkansas Supreme Court.

Grab your friends and family, and let's head to the polls!

posts.title: One Last Chance To See A Broadway Show This Season
posts.content:
The Walton Arts Center (WAC) recently wrapped up the P&G Broadway Series with Fiddler on the Roof, but fans have one more chance to see a Broadway show this season.

  • Exclusive: "A Chorus Line" will be at the WAC for a four-show run June 24-26 before launching an Asian tour. The performances in Northwest Arkansas are the only opportunities to see this new tour in the United States.
  • Iconic: "A Chorus Line" is the musical for "everyone who's ever had a dream and put it on the line." The show first debuted in 1975, and the iconic score features classics such as "What I Did for Love," "One," "I Hope I Get It," and more. 

For more tickets and info, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Workshop: Fayetteville's Bicycle-Friendly Business Bootcamp is on Wednesday, and there are only a few more spots for businesses, so sign up quick!
  • Getting up there: The Fort Smith Symphony is preparing for its 99th season!
  • Scores: Here's a list of scores from state title games this past Saturday. 
  • On TV: U of A's Inspirational Choral and Department of Music professor Jeffery Murdock recently appeared on PBS. 
  • Get over here: Let us know about your organization's initiative or event, and we'll see about putting it in our newsletter. Check out our advertising deals HERE.
